segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and I feel a little sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just drying that plate, completely missing the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching so high, and it makes me worry for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s going to tip over, and I don’t want him to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, and it’s kind of heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is making such a mess, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like the whole scene is just a little bit tragic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her task, and it’s like she’s in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but it’s like no one even notices it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope everything turns out okay for everyone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a metaphor for something, but I’m not sure what.
segments.speaker: PAR
